channel.title: ZEISS INSPECT App Python API News
channel.description: Latest updates and news for ZEISS INSPECT App development

item.title: ZEISS INSPECT 2026 Released
item.description: We are happy to announce that ZEISS INSPECT 2026 has been released. Watch out for App development related enhancements and new features!

item.title: Workflow Assistant
item.description: !Workflow Assistant The workflow assistant provides a new user interface for built-in ZEISS INSPECT commands or functions provided by Apps. It allows to organize these commands or functions in a user-friendly and efficient way. See <a href="../howtos/workflow_assistant/workflow_assistant.html">How-to Guides &ndash; Workflow Assistant</a> for more information and <a href="https://github.com/ZEISS/zeiss-inspect-app-examples/tree/main/AppExamples/misc/WorkflowAssistants">App Examples &ndash; W...

item.title: Update: Using Visual Studio Code as App Editor
item.description: The interface between ZEISS INSPECT and Visual Studio Code for App development and debugging has been re-implemented for enhanced reliability and additional features. See <a href="../howtos/using_vscode_editor/using_vscode_editor.html">Using Visual Studio Code as App editor</a> and <a href="../howtos/using_services/using_services.html#debugging-services">Using services &ndash; Debugging services</a> for details.

item.title: Using the 'gom_vec3d' and 'gom_math' modules
item.description: Did you know? Coordinates are often represented as gom.Vec3d objects in ZEISS INSPECT Apps. The gom_math module provides some functions for computations on gom.Vec3d objects. See <a href="../howtos/python_api_introduction/python_api_introduction.html#gom-vec3d-and-gom-math">ZEISS INSPECT Python API Introduction &mdash; gom_vec3d and gom_math</a> for details.

item.title: Link from App to external documentation
item.description: !App with help button, confirmation dialog and documentation web page ZEISS INSPECT 2025 allows to add a help button to App dialogs providing a web link to external documentation. See <a href="../howtos/app_documentation/app_documentation.html#link-to-external-documentation">Documenting Apps &mdash; Link to external documentation</a> for details.

item.title: Scripted Diagrams
item.description: !Scripted elements and scripted diagram Scripted diagrams have been added as a new feature in ZEISS INSPECT 2025. Scripted diagrams allow visualization of data provided by scripted elements in a very flexible way. More details can be found in <a href="../howtos/using_scripted_diagrams/using_scripted_diagrams.html">Using scripted diagrams</a>.

item.title: Services
item.description: !Manage services dialog In ZEISS INSPECT 2025, services have been introduced. A ZEISS INSPECT service is a Python script running continuously in the background, which exposes API functions to other scripts. Services can be distributed via Apps and can be used as computation kernels or callback targets. See <a href="../howtos/using_services/using_services.html">Using services</a> and <a href="../python_api/python_api.html#gom-api-services">Service API</a> for details.

item.title: Testing Apps with dialogs
item.description: Did you know that you can test Apps with <a href="../howtos/user_defined_dialogs/user_defined_dialogs.html">User-defined Dialogs</a> non-interactively? See <a href="../howtos/testing_apps/testing_apps.html#testing-apps-with-dialogs">How-to: Testing Apps &mdash; Testing Apps with Dialogs</a> for a detailed explanation.

item.title: ZEISS INSPECT 2025 Released
item.description: We are happy to announce that ZEISS INSPECT 2025 has been released. As always, you will find a multitude of new features and improvements. New App development related features will be presented here shortly.

item.title: Inserting a file selection dialog into a script
item.description: !Configure file selection dialog With ZEISS INSPECT 2025, it is possible to add a dialog for selecting files or folders by using RMB ► Insert ► File... in the script editor. See <a href="../howtos/python_api_introduction/file_selection_dialog.html">Selecting a file or folder</a> for details. This serves as a shortcut to creating a <a href="../howtos/user_defined_dialogs/user_defined_dialogs.html">User-defined dialog</a> if only a single file widget is needed.
